senses.sense_definition: A protective flap or hard plate in animals, such as the gill cover of a fish or the lid closing the opening of a snail shell.

examples.text: The fish pumps water over its gills by opening and closing its <w>operculum</w>.
When the tide goes out, the snail retreats into its shell and seals the entrance with its <w>operculum</w>.

senses.sense_definition: The lid-like part of a moss capsule or fruit that detaches to allow spores or seeds to be released.

examples.text: Once the moss spores are mature, the <w>operculum</w> falls off to let them disperse.
Botanists use the shape of the <w>operculum</w> to help identify different species of moss.

senses.sense_definition: A flap of gum tissue that covers part of a partially erupted tooth, often a wisdom tooth.

examples.text: Food particles trapped under the <w>operculum</w> can lead to a painful infection.
The dentist suggested removing the <w>operculum</w> to make cleaning the tooth easier.

senses.sense_definition: A portion of the cerebral cortex in the brain that covers the insula.

examples.text: Damage to the frontal <w>operculum</w> can significantly affect speech production.
The surgeon carefully navigated around the <w>operculum</w> to reach the deeper brain structures.

senses.sense_definition: A structure that serves as a cover or lid.

examples.text: I carefully lifted the circular <w>operculum</w> to inspect the contents of the container.
The ancient vessel was sealed with a heavy stone <w>operculum</w>.
